website_summaries.verdict: While not a high-end instrument, the Mendini does work well as a beginner's model.
pros: Easy to tune for group rehearsals
The case contains almost every necessary accessory and the violin is pre-strung
cons: Construction materials may not be as advertised
Bow and other accessories not as good as violin.Tuning pegs can come loose

customer_reviews.title: Lots of problems!!!
customer_reviews.text: This violin is pretty to look at, even though there is almost no flaming on the back as advertised. However, it sounds AWFUL. It actually sounds like a tin can and I upgraded the strings immediately. The winding on one of the bows was coming apart, and the loose cover inside the case is very dirty with ??. The tuner doesn't work and you may as well throw the shoulder rest away. I can't imagine the shoulder rest working well for anyone. It is a tiny, short little thing. Don't spend your money on it. Buy something a little more expensive that really does have sound you will enjoy listening to. I am very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Love my violins

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement...
customer_reviews.text: I received the cheap violin recently. I was not expecting much because of the price & this cheap violin actually sounds sort of okay. I am extremely disappointed with how this instrument was advertised as having ebony fingerboard, tail piece, chin rest & tuning pegs. Those so called ebony parts are in fact, not ebony at all. Those parts are some sort of inferior wood that has been stained or dyed black! As I said, I was not expecting much for the price. What pisses me off the most is the false advertisement. It has always been my understanding that if you falsely advertise a product, that is illegal, and you are setting yourself up for a lawsuit!
customer_reviews.author: TheJackRoller

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great package, excelent for beginners like me
customer_reviews.text: The violin looks beautiful. There are minor scratches in the surface, and some pencil marks (written numbers by hand) in the pegs, barely visible. The bridge came misaligned, and one of the strings needed replacement. Packaging was good, came to Costa Rica without being broken. The case looks very good, and the violin cover is a great addon. The tuner, the extra ( and smaller) bridge, and the tuner are great. The sound quality is very good, not only for a less than 200 dollar violin, but in general, for a beginner. Strongly recommend to take it straight to the closest luthier for tunning before using, ( or after a couple of uses if, like me, you also couldn't wait).
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment  - Setup as received is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is a very nice violin - not sure if the "Flamed" wood is Photoflame, but it looks nice. Unfortunately, the instrument I received, had the action set way, way to high - quite unplayable. At the price point, I'm going to return it - not worth paying a Violin shop to make it playable at an extra expense. I'll shop for a DZ Strad - much better reputation
customer_reviews.author: Master Of  Soul

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected. All components in the kit are very usable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an advanced violin player and have played a few different violins. Needed an extra violin for school and selected this budget model. This was better than expected. The strings have a very nice sound. This is at least as good as a Carlo Robelli RV505. Other than tuning very loose strings and shifting the wood bridge about 1mm to be centered under the strings, there was no other setup needed. No defects found thus far. The bows are very usable. The case is fine. The tuner is a nice addition, it works fine. It does come with an extra set of strings. The shoulder rest is a little uncomfortable, a Kun shoulder rest is much better.
customer_reviews.author: alanp

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an adult beginner. The violin arrived in great shape, the flame striping not as pronounced as in the picture but still lovely. The Sound is rich and melodic; comparable to my sister's antique William Louis&Sons Strad-type violin. My music teacher was impressed with the sound quality. I myself am thrilled; I thought I was getting a cheapie and instead got a gem. This violin was rated as one of the top beginner violins by Google when I did my research. I am enjoying playing this instrument very much.
customer_reviews.author: Kakari

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and photo is misleading!
customer_reviews.text: First of all it does not look anything like the photo in the description. Secondly there was a crack between the scroll and the E tuning peg. Very disappointed with this item. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: sounds magnificent
customer_reviews.text: i play a bit of keyboards, can hanlde a guitar as a beginner, wanted to play some viollin, after setting all up and breaking some strings due to impatience, i managed to set all up... patience is a virtue! In the process i learned a lot, tuning, using pegs and micro tuners, applying peg compound, applying rosin to the bow hairs. I was amazed what full sound this sent out. amazing , it is surely motivating me to go further with the playing lessons
customer_reviews.author: Deedub

customer_reviews.title: I recommend Jade rosin
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced player of 23 years and have been teaching for 10 years. This is an incredible quality instrument for the price. However the rosin, bow and strings should be replaced if you are looking to get/or are serious with your musicianship. I recommend Jade rosin, Pirastro strings, and a braided carbon fiber bow with Mongolian horsehair (DZ Strad produces quality affordable bows that last). Also, if you are looking for a precise tuner I recommend Snark clip on tuners.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Ebony fingerboard??
customer_reviews.text: This was a good beginner violin. Something I liked was that it stayed in tune and needed only minor occasional adjustment. It originally arrived with a broken fine tuner. Cecelio customer service was excellent and sent me a new one right away. What I didnt like was the fact that the fingerboard was painted black. If it is made of ebony as the product description details, why did it need to be painted? The black paint started to wear off after 21 months of use which did not look attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, def beginners violin
customer_reviews.text: Came with a small scratch near the f hole however I love the look. Of course the bow and string quality is really cheap, as soon as you can switch those out. The rosin is decent, but the tuner is trash. The bridge looks like it’s set up okay but I’ll have it adjusted by a pro soon
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: fully decked out!!
customer_reviews.text: The violin is beautiful, case is totally decked out on the inside and the items it comes with! It's better than the instrument I got when I was younger from the local instrument shop up the street from my house. I was only disappointed about the delivery time, said two days which would be a Wednesday, but showed up Thursday. my daughter needed it before then so u know it was a big deal. but otherwise it's an awesome violin!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Layne G

customer_reviews.title: She was very pleased with it's construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife who wanted to play again after a having many years from High School. She was very pleased with it's construction, size and the other accessories that can along with it. The wood stain and finish was also very nice. Her instructor was also pleased with it and would recommend it to her other beginner adult students. Her only suggestion was to get better strings and rosin. As for my wife, she practices every day.
customer_reviews.author: Berry-1

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful piece. Came with everything listed packaged with care
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful piece. Came with everything listed packaged with care. I did purchase different strings and i will be replacing the peg board. The bows are sweet and the rosin is just fine lots of reviews said it wasn't great. I may agree that the tuner isn't my favorite but its nice and came with batteries. It will definitely be kept as a backup. All in all very happy she has a sweet sound. I tuned her and have already played her for two hours (By peg board i mean the fine tuning pegs at the bottom. I feel that my G fine tuning isn't working the way it should )
customer_reviews.author: Faye Hill

customer_reviews.title: The violin has a beautiful finish, but could do with a nicer set ...
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my 10-year-old daughter who after seeing me play violin took an interest. The violin has a beautiful finish, but could do with a nicer set of strings. The chin rest fell off and i had to readjust it. One of the bows hair is falling apart but the other was fine. It did not come with a book, which it should have. It was preowned but this was not stated in discription. Still happy with the violin but a little disappointed that things were not as they should have been.
customer_reviews.author: LucilleLelant

customer_reviews.title: not a pro violinist
customer_reviews.text: but it seems to be ok made. The rosin came cracked and shattered. The bow had hair in backward (according to his teacher) and needed to be tightened a LOT. Strings are ok, may be why sound isn't as great as expected, got replacement strings haven't tried yet. Case is very nice, lots of handles and straps and protects it well, very lightweight for a 5th grader.
customer_reviews.author: kelli roinick

customer_reviews.title: We do need better quality strings but once he gets better then we'll ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to give it 5 star rating, my boy loves playing it as do I (although I need a bigger one). We do need better quality strings but once he gets better then we'll get him better strings. Anyhow great buy. One small issue: I couldn't keep the violin in tune, the peg kept slipping, I called Cecilio they advised me to add some rosin to the peg it self and then tune it, well that worked perfectly! Violin is still in tuning fine and no more peg slipping!
customer_reviews.author: Art and Carmen Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth any money at all
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, and was very excited about reading all of the good reviews. But It is very cheaply made, never fully was able to tune, and the sound quality wasn't good at all. It reminded me of a child's toy rather than an actual instrument. It was nice that it came with rosin, two bows, extra string set, and a nice and durable case though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget violin
customer_reviews.text: first) all budget violins just suck, lets start with that my instructor was still quite impressed with mine, sounded better for the lower end of violins. the bow is fairly meh and the rosin is meh too, but for the prices, hard to actually complain. great for a beginner to learn on (i'm a beginner!)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Asper

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The violin looked great and arrive in great condition. The case protected it very well. The wood is clearly worked to look like flamed maple (it isn't) but it was well done and no complaints for the price. The instrument looks great. So far I sound terrible but it isn't the instrument's fault. Cats will vacate the area.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Claxton

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it, just know what you’re buying
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty violin. If you are looking for a cheap display instrument, or something for a kid or beginner, look no further. But if you have any plans to play violin into the future I would hold off on this one. The instrument really is beautiful though with a fiery wood tone that I had never seen in a string instrument before. I’d say it’s worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I love my new violin
customer_reviews.text: This violin is absolutely stunning. It sounds like it looks - rich, deep, dark, mysterious, emotional. I changed strings, upgraded to Pirastro Tonica, new rosin Pirastro Goldflex, plus got a new Kun Solo rest and can't be happier. Definitely recommend to any beginner, even if you can't change strings it is still worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: smithie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Violin
customer_reviews.text: Received as a gift and the violin has a beautiful color, came with one replacement string of each G,D,A, and E. The shoulder rest is of good quality and the case is excellent with plenty of storage for bows, extra strings, rosin, the shoulder rest, and more. It even has a carrying strap which makes it easy to carry. The electronic tuner was missing when we initially received the violin but with an email to the manufacturer it was sent within 24 hours! The bows are nice and violin is a great violin for the hobbyist or someone who is just starting to play. It is just what I was looking for and I was thrilled to receive it!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey M Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction and sound for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the Sound and Quality of this Violin. Nice hard shell case and 2 bows and spare bridge. Well worth the price. 4 star for sound quality because I can't play it that good yet. Better than spending $4,000 for a professional one.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM DEGAYNOR

customer_reviews.title: Everything You Need
customer_reviews.text: Along with an extra bow and set of strings, the Mendini violin comes with a tuner and a chin rest. I don't think I would have bought a chin rest if it wasn't supplied. I was surprised at how much it helps. The violin is beautiful. I also love the supplied carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Cosmetically superior
customer_reviews.text: Cosmetically, this is a great instrument. The attention to detail is what you would expect from a $500-600 violin of similar quality. Tonally it leaves something to be desired though I believe with the correct strings, bow and adjustments this will be an excellent choice for anyone looking for a quality violin to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Life Long Learner

customer_reviews.title: This violin is a great value. Music teacher was very impressed with not ...
customer_reviews.text: This violin is a great value. Music teacher was very impressed with not only its quality but with all the extras that came with it. My husband did a lot of research before purchasing this instrument so we already had high expectations for it and it has met it so far. My son is amateur but has had very experienced violinist play his violin and all have been impressed with its quality and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great student violin
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful instrument! Easy to set up, makes a beautiful sound (when being played correctly, some horrible noises inevitable with beginner usage), and comes with fantastic accessories! I'm not sure how it compares to more professional instruments, but it's been great to learn on!
customer_reviews.author: RGY.JP

customer_reviews.title: Strings are unable to be changed.
customer_reviews.text: The violin arrived broken. A string was broke and a tuner peg was missing. Unfortunately, the strings are clamped shut in there so we can’t even change the string. Huge bummer when my daughter opened it as a birthday gift.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Violin is ok.... Strings are terrible!
customer_reviews.text: The violin itself seems ok, it definitely does not look anything like the picture, the Flaming is barely there, and the color is much different. The pegs do not stay put, and the strings are awful!!!! I didn't even get to play it and the G string broke! It came with a second set of strings, so I replaced the one that had broke, that instantly broke as well. Very disappointed with that! Also, I've noticed some rough and unfinished spots. I'm very disappointed that I can't even play it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Lilith

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Well I don't know about the other buyers but my flame too was very well done. Replaced the factory strings and rosin and it sounds great! A great buy for the buck and my daughter LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Kev Dog

customer_reviews.title: if it sounds good(yes it does)
customer_reviews.text: when i first got it i was very excited when i oped it it was great 1. the violin was very pretty and it was the one shown in the pic 2. the strings: when i go it the e string was not on the peg but that's ok your instructor can put it on 3. the rosin: it came broken but it does not matter 4. the bow: it took me a while to put rosin on it this interment is very good i recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter violin for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was very sceptical about ordering this violin. But I have to say it is very nice and we'll constructed for the price. After a Little work shaping the bridge, and waking up the strings. It hold a perfect G196.00, D293.66, A440.00, E659.00 tune. It's make a beautiful tune when playing. The reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is: the shoulder rest is too small. I'm using it but will need a better one. Quality rosin. Quality tuner.
customer_reviews.author: RageQuit Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Verry happy with this purchase . It came with 2 bows, and exstra set of stings, an exstra bridge, quality rosin, and a tuner . I like the fine tune knobs on this one. Very precise. I like the color of the wood. A great deal for the price. Sound quality is acceptable. Better than my other violin.
customer_reviews.author: theresa shanley

customer_reviews.title: good deal for price
customer_reviews.text: The pegs are cheap and loose. I had to really press them in to be able to hold a tune. But if you have NEVER played and want to give it a shot, this is a great deal for the price. Just know, you get what you pay for. Real violins go for thousands and strings are up there for $50-100 (maybe more). So don't expect it to sound as if it came from a show room floor. Also (just so you know, ROSIN the bow before you start playing or you'll not only ruin the bow but you won't get any sound.) Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great violin, but the rest ...?
customer_reviews.text: I like the violin a lot. It's very sharp looking and the sound is fine. I replace the strings immediately. They were not good. I replaced the bow with an Amazon Brazilwood bow. The tuner is good. I replaced the rosin. The case is good. Now I have a great outfit. Give us a decent bow, decent strings and decent Rosen and charge $200 and you have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Edward R. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Not a good violin
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 because it's pretty and the bow was nice. That's about it. It does not stay in tune and the E string does not sound right ever! We had to buy a new shoulder rest and tuner. The ones that came with were not good. Already bought another violin to replace this one and not happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Only for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty but you get what you pay for (and don’t pay for.) Good for a beginner but go to a higher priced one if you can. This instrument is very squeaky when played. But you CAN learn on it. Once you get better at playing you will want a more quality instrument!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bad tuning pegs
customer_reviews.text: The tuning pegs just don’t stay in place whenever I try to tune it. Even when the strings have had time to stretch... I’ve had this for a year and never play it because the pegs just spring back and I’m afraid I’ll break a string from frustration. The sound is fine, and it looks beautiful for the price, but none of that matters if I can’t tune it!
customer_reviews.author: Lex G

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The strings were cheap but the sound was not bad. The problem came when I turned it around and looked at the back of it. The neck was slightly off center kind of at an angle that I could see without taking any measurements. I am returning it today and will now be trying out a different violin to see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: Frances R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry level instrument, recommended
customer_reviews.text: I play as a hobbiest and I'm overall pleased with this violin. Its esthetically pleasing too..a mature-looking aged finish, not a tomato soup orange finish. Sound is pretty fair and the tuners are responsive. In satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved the violin and decided I want to learn to play. I haven’t yet started playing yet but I will say this is a beautiful violin. I will definitely update in the future. I’m looking forward to trying to play :)
customer_reviews.author: Mariji

customer_reviews.title: Great as a first instrument
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Daughter loves it and it is being utilized as a first violin for my daughter who is just learning how to play. Great product and value for a good instrument and all the extras included.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Liebno

customer_reviews.title: initially sound purchase
customer_reviews.text: This came in extremely fast. The violin has been purchased for a second year violin student and will pay for itself in a couple of months by not having to rent. After watching numerous videos about this package, I felt confident in the purchase. My daughter had no problems getting it up and running and it is an attractive well balanced piece. Her teacher seems to be moderately impressed by its build and rich sound and has even begun recommending the package to others ....time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful  Violin.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this violin. She is going for lessons. It puts tears in my eyes to see how happy the violin makes her. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'll buy a better instrument, but this will do for now
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to have a cheap violin to pick it up again. The instrument is playable, but the strings are awful and the paint on the fingerboard rubs off on your fingers when playing. If I get more serious, I'll buy a better instrument, but this will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: apmb

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly beautiful piece. I didn't expect a whole lot for the money and I was pleasantly surprised. The sound quality is very good. The workmanship is great. Very sturdy and beautiful piece. Did I mention it's beautiful?
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Well designed!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my hubby...i love how sturdy the case is..violin itself is beautiful..after so many of them he finally likes this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Dipixa Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like the bow.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not bad, but it’s not the quality of the violin I had growing up, for sure. Especially the bow. All in all, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: This was my first violin and like many others
customer_reviews.text: This was my first violin and like many others, I found that an upgrade in strings made a HUGE difference. As a beginner, I appreciated the fact this violin stayed in tune most of the time. I have only been playing for a year now and own a higher-quality violin as well, but I still enjoy playing this one, and the color is absolutely gorgeous. (It's the prettiest violin I have ever seen.) Many people have commented on the rich varnish on this violin and have been surprised that it is a Mendini. Oh, and definitely buy a better shoulder rest. This one is cheap and uncomfortable. Otherwise, you'll definitely get your money's worth with this violin.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Defective Wood
customer_reviews.text: I seen a Defect in the wood on the upper Neck, should have sent it back, But I did not it broke in half two days later. I fixed it . You could tell someone tried to do a repair on it. Very poor work. Will never buy this Brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my fiance. He absolutely loves it! Great sound and great for the price! Easy set up!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Demarco

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fine Tuner
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to play the violin. The first violin we bought was a Mendini and it was great! She wanted to upgrade with the Mendini MV500 with fine tuners. Two of the tuners broke off after two weeks. She is not a beginner Violinist and is the top of her advanced class. It was disappointing after the first beginner Mendini outlasted the more expensive MV500.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jewel of a violin!
customer_reviews.text: This violin is gorgeous and has a rich tone. My adult daughter wanted to learn how to play the violin while her Navy husband is deployed. She was ecstatic when she got it for Christmas. The USP people who delivered it... were very impressed! She opened it in front of them. She was so excited that she didn't even give them time to get out of their truck! It is worth every cent we paid for it! Best of all! This violin is on Amazon Prime and ships immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Robins Whiting

customer_reviews.title: Great violin for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the violin for myself, a beginner. Not knowing what a quality violin is I just went with the reviews. I was pleased with the violin delivered. I give 4 stars since the E string was not wound on the peg and there was no explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M. Arruda

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with my purchase. Two bows, extra bridge, good condition and full package deal for an excellent price! Very excited and will probably change the strings as recommended by others.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: It’s totally disappointing! The bridge is too low that the strings are stick to the bridge. You can’t play it at all when you play open string or in first position.
customer_reviews.author: xiaowei liu

customer_reviews.title: not a bad sound but def get good strings(love the dominant strings)and ...
customer_reviews.text: Little advice, not a bad sound but def get good strings(love the dominant strings)and some better quality rosin. Other than that i like it. Im not no Mark O'Connor so i cant exactly tell you what a $5k fiddle plays like but i can tell you im having fun with this one. Didn't have any of the issues some of the others had. Was just like the photo when i got it. So in short.....Jam on my fellow fiddle freaks!!
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: I like this violin a lot !
customer_reviews.text: I am 69 years old and just wanted to try violin. This is a beautiful instrument that won't break the bank! Looks great, plays well. I did buy a carbon fiber bow from vingo for $30.00 that went a long way in improving the package. Very hard to complain about this very nice beginners violin.
customer_reviews.author: sjbrn1Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure there are better quality violins out there
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well for my 11 year old who is in orchestra at school. I'm sure there are better quality violins out there, but for a beginner this seems to work very well. We may upgrade if she stays committed to the violin.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bow could be nicer
customer_reviews.text: Overall works well. Some clean up needed on the body. Bows could be better since the hairs fell out of one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Yochum

customer_reviews.title: Great as far as I can tell
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews, the tag on the inside of the violin says MV 650. The violin has a few imperfections cosmically. Hardly noticeable tho. This is my first violin so can't compair it to others. The rosin works fine. The tuner works great. I have been trying to mimic some online videos of people playing the violin and it sounds compairable. Took me a while to tune it with the tuner as I didn't really know what i was doing. Easy once I got the hang of it. Had to straighten the bridge tho. Plenty of free online videos to help with any of this.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous! And so many gadgets for the price
customer_reviews.text: My favorite part of this instrument is the way it's crafted. Simple, yet professional! The turner you recieve is absolutely fantastic, just takes some getting used to after you press all the lil buttons. Best instrument I've ever bought! Case is also very durable.
customer_reviews.author: MelodyM

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: I had several people try to help me out with it. The thing didn't make any noise - even after the bow was tightened, rosined up, everything was tuned. Total piece of crap. I just gave it to a friend so her kids could play with it. I don't know if I just got a faulty one, but it was bizarre how it just didn't work at all. Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Amber VanDaele

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Violin
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful violin for beginners! I’m a beginner violinist and was able to tune it on my own. Make sure you watch the video and read the instructions before using it if you’re a newbie like me. It sounds great and it holds down the tune, been practicing all day and didn’t need to retune it. I’m happy with the beginner set. It has everything that I need.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Its worth buying
customer_reviews.text: My only worry was my violin breaking during shipment but everything came in one piece, sounds amazing and clear, even comes with a couple extra goodies. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Alamo

customer_reviews.title: We own a few...
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these violins and they are a decent quality and sound for the price. I have been very happy with them as they hold their tune well and have a mellow sound for a new violin with a set of decent strings.
customer_reviews.author: Homegrowntomatoes

customer_reviews.title: First time Violin Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice violin. First time violinist, long time musician. Maybe if I took lessons, I would have more appreciation for it. As a guitar player, I find the lack of frets on a violin incredibly frustrating. I never realized the frets make up for the slop in my finger placement. On a violin, if you move your finger up a half fret, the note is a half fret out of tune. My hate is off to anyone who is good at this.
customer_reviews.author: DMFN

customer_reviews.title: so good. Will likely upgrade to a higher quality if ...
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived with a crack in the violin but was replaced quickly. Four months into my sons music program, so far, so good. Will likely upgrade to a higher quality if my son continues, but a good beginner violin!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and good for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I was not aware this instrument needs to be built when it shows up. Maybe it says that somewhere and i missed it but i had to pay a person to put the thing together for me. It is not ready to play. Very good quality and good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Rory D. Neuman

customer_reviews.title: Total crap. Could not turn any of the tuners at ...
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. Could not turn any of the tuners at all. I put the bow on the string and pulled and the string snapped with one stroke. Go to a specialty store and buy in person. This was not set up properly.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Really nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: The music teacher was pretty impressed w/ the quality and the affordable price. Perfect for a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Violin! Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great violin! It sounds great, and it holds its tune for a while! The bows are sub-par, and need to be replaced but outside of that, everything else is solid. We use this tuner over our other one, and the violin case is great! I think I have even heard a hint of jealousy from my daughter's music teacher when she first talked to us about the new violin!
customer_reviews.author: Michael  C

customer_reviews.title: the infomation
customer_reviews.text: i did not buy this instrument before but my friend has a violin and the sound like awful for the person just play the first time, but the sound of my violin is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nhathuynh

customer_reviews.title: For the price, hard to be beat!
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck. Tonal quality is bright, powerful, but totally exceptional for the price.I would recommend this to the beginner without hesitation. DM
customer_reviews.author: Dmacsimus

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for novice.
customer_reviews.text: It was for a beginner. The violin teacher said the violin was serviceable. The shoulder rest (or chin rest, I forget) was too cheaply made, and not acceptable by the violin teacher. We ended up buying a better one. The case is surprisingly good. For the price, it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit Loves

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this violin. It looks amazing and sounds great for a better student violin.
customer_reviews.author: chrisoud

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for my daughter who decided she wanted to learn. Comes with extras that are great for a beginner. Sounds good. Had to replace a string right away because it wouldn't tune right. Other than that she loves it. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: May Berdeen

customer_reviews.title: Music Guru Approved...
customer_reviews.text: We took it in to a music store today after having the violin for two years, the owner was surprised of the quality and said it was a great instrument for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bromy

customer_reviews.title: High high high quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality compared to price, made me feel I bought a piece of art rather than just a violen. Also, IV got a Saxophone from the same seller, really impressed with quality and details compared to value of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rakan

customer_reviews.title: Great violin for my 12 yr old.
customer_reviews.text: This violin is great compared to the $80 one we got before and had to return. This one was very easy to tune. The pegs staying nicely in place and violin is retaining its sound for days without having to tune it again. It’s worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Roblox_Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I played for several years... years ago. Decided I wanted to play again, however am on a budget. I decided to go for this student package and just return it if it was not worth it. I am SO IMPRESSED!! it is a very nice looking and sounding violin. Of course if you are in the symphony look elsewhere but if you aren't professional, it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Potts

customer_reviews.title: So far So good!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on scheduled date and fully assembled, all i had to do was tune it. So far so good! The bows and rosin are somewhat crappy and i plan on replacing the strings soon because right now it sounds squeeky. Make sure your bridge is aligned properly and fine tuners are not twisted in all the way before tuning!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: A steal
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can’t be beat! Change rosin and strings ASAP, but otherwise, as steal imho.
customer_reviews.author: Sosakan

customer_reviews.title: It's okay with me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift, I know nothing about violins so am not qualified to comment of the instrument. It arrived promptly and without damage. The recipient had a hard time opening the rosin.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryne Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner/intermediate model
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my daughter's first full-sized violin based on other reviews. Not really concerned about rosin and bow at this stage, though one of the bows is just fine. Rosin isn't, of course, strings were dusty, but okay. Violin sounds nice...a bit haunting, so it's a new sound. Enough so that her teacher is interested in having one of these as an extra instrument. All in all, good violin for the price, knowing you are primarily purchasing the violin.
customer_reviews.author: CKeffer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed and sad
customer_reviews.text: Fingerboard is painted black its not real ebony. It’s painted rubbed off my fingers. Cheap pillow it doesn’t even work. Light varnish. Picture was tick wood and dark varnish.
customer_reviews.author: SeymaOzcan

customer_reviews.title: Although it's beautiful the fingerboard does not seem to made of ebony ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it's beautiful the fingerboard does not seem to made of ebony but the pegs are (they sink in water). It sounds really good not as good as my old german one but fairly decent to practice on. Also regular chalk rubbed on the pegs will keep them from sliding out of tune hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner, or someone playing again after many years like me, this is the perfect instrument. It comes ready to play out of the box. It is easy to tune and, with new Dominant strings, the sound is surprisingly full, yet mellow. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: You are never too old...

customer_reviews.title: It's meh...
customer_reviews.text: The violin seems to be very cheap in quality. Does not look like what is pictured. Rosin was already cracked with pieces coming off. The bow had a few broken hairs.The quality of the wood also feels a bit cheap. I can't give this a five star review.
customer_reviews.author: NurseMissy1985

customer_reviews.title: Great violin for student
customer_reviews.text: This is a great student violin. The sound quality is good and the pieces that come with it are all very useful. The shoulder rest is the only thing I would change. it is small and not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: amwarner

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Will update after I can make proper sounds with it... My friend can so I guess the violin is good enough
customer_reviews.author: D.E.Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Just wish my grandson would practice more very nice violin
customer_reviews.author: zelly

customer_reviews.title: You know for a cheap violin its actually robust and ...
customer_reviews.text: You know for a cheap violin its actually robust and well made.. I wasnt expecting much but i got way more then i expected
customer_reviews.author: James Qeastar

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: A very nice sounding violin, excellent starter kit for new players.
customer_reviews.author: DMR

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful instrument for what was paid. You get a lot for the money. I wouldn't recommend for a pro. Best for a student.
customer_reviews.author: Paulena Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sounds real nice after all. glad i went with this higher end model.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: does not look as cool as in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Solid violin. does not look as cool as in the picture, but still sounds good. A little hard to keep in tune, i have to spend about 10 mins adjusting every time before i practice.
customer_reviews.author: Keval

customer_reviews.title: Buy two cause you gonna love it
customer_reviews.text: Great piece for the money has a great rich tone and beautiful craftsmanship glad that they included the instructions because I would have never thought to rosin the pegs. Excellent beginner violin
customer_reviews.author: Peter scariati

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert at all but I think it has great sound. Was easy to tune. Checked it a few days later and was really close to tuned. Minor adjustments needed. Much better than others I've tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mendini MV500+92D Flamed 1-Piece Back Solid Wood Violin with Case, Tuner, Shoulder Rest, Bow, Rosin, Bridge and Strings (Size: 4/4 (Full Size))
product_meta.description:
Size:Size: 4/4 (Full Size)

Violin Parts FROM THE MANUFACTURER
All of our violins are handcrafted instruments that are tested at our factory and inspected again by skilled technicians at our Los Angeles distribution center prior to shipping. Please read the setup and tuning instructions carefully after receiving the violin. It will help you understand how to set up and tune the violin.

VIOLIN OWNER'S MANUAL
Exposure to sudden changes in temperature and humidity can affect your violin. Avoid direct, extended exposure to: sunlight, rain, heaters, or air conditioners. Violins are delicate instruments and can be damaged easily if not handled with care. The violin needs to be assembled and tuned prior to playing. We recommend first time players to seek assistance from an instructor. If an instructor is not available, follow these steps below.



Bridge SETTING UP THE BRIDGE
The bridge is a very important piece because it transmits the sound of the violin. The tension between the strings and the top of the violin keeps the bridge in place. Bridges are not glued on the instruments. Keep in mind that not all players have the same size hands and fingers making the size of the bridge different for every player. The bridge can be customized by a violin luthier in order to draw out a better tone from the violin. If the bridge is not set, follow these simple instructions. First, position the bridge with higher side of the bridge under the lowest string, the G string. Tilt the bridge up under the strings toward the tailpiece and set it at a 90-degree angle. If the bridge cannot be tilted, the strings are too tight. Loosen the strings slowly and just enough to hold the bridge in place. Align the feet of the bridge with the two notches of the "F" holes and align the bridge evenly with the fingerboard. Evenly spaced out the strings on the bridge. To tighten the strings, turn the pegs clockwise while pushing them towards the peg box for better grip and stability. If the pegs are slipping, use peg drop oil to lock the pegs in place or use rosin powder as a substitution.

APPLYING ROSIN CAKE ON THE BOW
Keep in mind, the bow must be tightened and rosined in order to produce a sound on the violin. Also do not touch the hair on the bow since the oils from the skin can damage the hair.To tighten the hair, tighten the screw below the frog. Be careful to not over tighten the bow. Ideally, the distance between the hair and the lowest curve on the bow is about a quarter inch (1/4"). It may vary to every player. The hair should have a slight bounce to it. Test the bow on the strings. A new rosin cake will be too smooth to apply to the hair. To turn the rosin to powder, take a pocketknife and cut three to four parallel lines on the rosin so that there will be texture to the rosin. Sandpaper is an alternative to help roughen the surface. Hold the frog on the bow and slowly rub the hair over the rosin from the frog to the tip of the bow. Be careful not to rub the bow too quickly. On a new bow, continue this process for approximately 5-10 minutes. Test the bow to determine if the rosin is adhering to the hair. If a clear pitch is emitted as the bow is drawn over the strings, play a few notes and its ready to go. If there is no tone or volume emitting from the strings the bow is not grabbing the strings enough to generate a note, try applying more rosin.

TUNING
Gradually tighten each string in the sequence of G-D-A-E. Starting with the thicker string is to prevent damages to the thinner A and E strings. Tighten one strings at a time, and only 1 to 2 notes higher. Do not tighten one string all the way to the desired pitch while leaving the other strings very loose. Doing so will create unequal pressure on the bridge causing it to fall. Generally, strings take time to wear/settle in. New strings tend to lose their tension quicker than older used strings. To accelerate the process of wearing in new strings, tune the strings to the desired pitch then slightly pull on the strings to stretch them out. After pulling on the string, most likely it will need to be re-tune. If the string pitch is sharp (high) loosen the string slightly until the string pitch is flat (low). Slightly tighten the peg until desired pitch is reach. Adjust the pegs to make larger adjustments and the fine tuners to make smaller adjustments.

Shoulder Rest ATTACHING THE SHOULDER REST (AVAILABLE IN SIZE 4/4 TO 1/10)
First, loosen the screws on the back of the shoulder rest. Then adjust the feet to length of the lower bout of the violin. Tighten the screws back to hold position. The feet of the shoulder rest clamp on the edges of the lower bout of the violin. Gently spread the feet to fit over the edge and snap in place.

SLIPPERY PEGS
The pegs can shrink or expand due to the temperature and humidity changes. When the peg shrink, it will not fit the peg hole as well as they were originally made. It will leave a little gap between the peg and peg hole. This is why the pegs slip. Simply apply the rosin powder or peg drop oil on the pegs and peg hole. This will fill the little gap in between and increase friction. New strings will require some stretching before they settle in and hold pitch. Slightly pull the strings upwards to accelerate the settling in process. Keep in mind that adjusting the pegs make larger adjustments and the fine tuners make smaller adjustments. Periodically, check the violin's tune. Depending on the weather (temperature and humidity level), the amount of time and type of playing, the violin may need to be re-tune. In ideal conditions, this would not be necessary.
feature_bullets: Solid hand-carved 1-piece maple back, neck and side violin wtih solid hand-carved spruce top with beautiful varnish finish & inlaid purfling
Ebony fingerboard, pegs chin rest, and tailpiece with 4 detachable fine tuners
Cecilio 92D chromatic / string tuner with metronome, 2 x Brazil wood bows with unbleached genuine Mongolian horsehair
Includes: Lightweight hard case, adjustable shoulder rest, 2 bridges, quality rosin cake, and an extra set of violin strings.
